viewsWelcome.status.contents:
The status and information of Lix are shown here.
You can create a file with Lix.
[New File](command:workbench.action.files.newUntitledFile)
Or open a Lix file.
[Open File](command:workbench.action.files.openFile)
You can also convert an existing file to Lix format.
[Convert File to Lix (AI)](command:lix.convertFile)
This function is powered by AI.
configuration.title: Lix
configuration.latexCommand.mac.descripti: Command used to invoke LaTeX on macOS.
configuration.latexCommand.linux.descrip: Command used to invoke LaTeX on Linux.
configuration.latexCommand.windows.descr: Command used to invoke LaTeX on Windows.
configuration.cacheDirectory.description: Directory for temporary build artifacts. Relative paths are resolved from the current Lix file.
languageModelTool.syntaxTree.modelDescri: Get the syntax tree of Lix in current document.
languageModelTool.parseMessages.modelDes: Get the parse messages of Lix in current document
languageModelTool.markdownOutput.modelDe: Get the markdown output of Lix in current document
languageModelTool.latexOutput.modelDescr: Get the LaTeX output of Lix in current document
languageModelTool.outputUri.modelDescrip: Get the output file URI of Lix in current document. The uri is valid only if the current document is lix file.
chatParticipant.lix.description: AI assistant for Lix, the Light LaTeX.
